title: Man pinned down by police in Parliament grounds as MPs debate Brexit
text:
The man was pinned to the ground near Westminster Hall (Picture:@johnjohnstonmi/Twitter)

Armed police have seized a suspected Commons intruder in New Palace Yard outside of Westminster Hall, it has been reported.

A large group of police appear to have pinned someone down outside Parliament, where MPs are currently debating Boris Johnson’s Brexit deal.

An MP eyewitness told a reporter eight police officers ‘jumped’ on the man but it was ‘unclear why’.

It is understood he was attempting to get through turnstiles into a part of the Commons restricted to pass holders.

He was handcuffed and then led off the parliamentary estate where he was bundled into a police van, the Mirror reports.

Large group of police appear to have someone pinned to the floor outside Westminster Hall. Moved me away pretty quickly. Second security breach in two days?? pic.twitter.com/vI29dEGkwi — John Johnston (@johnjohnstonmi) October 19, 2019

The man managed to get into the grounds of the Palace of Westminster (Picture: LNP)

Armed police have just seized a suspected Commons intruder in New Palace Yard outside of Westminster Hall. An MP eyewitness: “About 8 cops jumped on him, it was unclear why”. — Tom Newton Dunn (@tnewtondunn) October 19, 2019

Eyewitnesses say he was wearing a rucksack and dressed in a quilted green jacket and dark jeans.

A Westminster insider said he had been ‘behaving strangely’.

There is a large police presence outside Parliament today, because the sitting coincides with a the largest People’s Vote march the UK has seen.

Hundreds of thousands of people are marching from Hyde Park to parliament demanding a final say on the Brexit deal.

A Spokesperson for Parliamentary authorities said: ‘We are aware of an incident involving a visitor in a public area of the Parliamentary estate. Security staff and the Police attended and the situation has been resolved.’

A Metropolitan Police spokesman said: ‘At 1323hrs, officers arrested a 29-year-old man at the Palace of Westminster for trespassing at a protected site.

‘He has been taken to a south London police station. Enquiries ongoing.’

This is a breaking news story. More on this to follow
